nodes.title: Culture Trumps Everything
nodes.excerpt: Because our company had been doing such a great job with our small contract, we were awarded the contract for the rest of Colorado. nodes.title: Sit Down. Be Humble
nodes.excerpt: We finally got through the big launch our company. We hired a team, all of the equipment was ready to go, and all that was left to do was execute. nodes.title: A Helpful Process for your Tight Deadline
nodes.excerpt: Are you a process thinker? Or does your brain naturally lean toward big ideas? If you’re like a lot of entrepreneurs, you aren’t necessarily a systems guy. nodes.title: My Epic Management Fails
nodes.excerpt: A senior in college, I spent most weekends and holidays QCing work, driving to New Mexico, and staying in fleabag hotels wherever the business needed me to travel. I was all in. nodes.title: Entrepreneurship: The Ultimate Test of Courage
nodes.excerpt: I’m an entrepreneur. The prospect of starting a new adventure gets me up in the morning. You might be the same way. nodes.title: Hiring Your First Managers? Know What You’re Looking For
nodes.excerpt: To say that we had no idea what we were getting into when we started our company would be an understatement. Have you ever felt that way? Have you ever felt like you were in over your head and ill-equipped to do the job you created for yourself? I’ve been there. The first time I […]

nodes.title: Always Play the Long Game
nodes.excerpt: People are naturally short-sided. Maybe it’s the culture in which we grew up or the way that we’re wired… or a little bit of both. You and I have difficulty seeing beyond today and planning for the future. It’s why so many people get to retirement age and realize they should have saved for retirement. […]

nodes.title: The Power of Customer Service
nodes.excerpt: Customer service is a powerful force for the growth of your business. And the beautiful part, especially when it comes to starting a company from scratch, is that it’s free! I learned the impact of good, customer service when my family and I were starting our business. I was in college at the time and […]

nodes.title: Dealing with the Unexpected
nodes.excerpt: In business, there will be external threats to your success. There will be unexpected trends that force you to rely on your own self-confidence and creativity. nodes.title: Trial by Fire
nodes.excerpt: In spite of my average athletic ability, I worked hard in High School and was lucky enough to get the opportunity to play Division II football.
